channel.title: URL Blocked..?
channel.description:
So yeah..
Whenever I view the "List of Resources" topic located at the General Programming sub-forum, my anti-virus gives a pop-up saying a malicious URL was blocked. I am wondering why this is happening.

item.title: URL Blocked..?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

I moved this into General Questions board, as this is a question

Read full topic

item.title: URL Blocked..?
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“Derpington, post:1, topic:444602”]’‘www.moparisthebest.com contains contect from flashvidplayer.com, a site known to distribute malware.’’

Why does it contain contect from ‘‘flashvidplayer’’ when it’s a known issue that they distribute malware? I don’t quite understand. And if there is this link in someone’s signature, why not remove the signature (or the user himself) ?

So if I understand correctly, My anti-virus blocked the link before I even could go there, cause the link was on the page I was viewing? In other words, there’s no harm done, right?[/quote]
This is because of the advertisements. There is nothing wrong with the site, and the advertisements hold no virus either but they are from the advertisements.

Read full topic

item.title: URL Blocked..?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Google Chrome automatically blocks this website because

[b]www.moparisthebest.com[/b] contains content from [b]flashvidplayer.com[/b], a site known to distribute malware. Your computer might catch a virus if you visit this site. We have already notified [b]flashvidplayer.com[/b] that we found malware on the site. For more about the problems found on [b]flashvidplayer.com[/b], visit the Google [url=http://safebrowsing.clients.google.com/safebrowsing/diagnostic?site=http%3A%2F%2Fflashvidplayer.com%2Fsmileyhappy.ico&client=googlechrome&hl=en-US]Safe Browsing diagnostic page[/url].

You can visit it. There’s only a member who posted with that link in his signature that caused your anti-virus and google chrome to do this.

Read full topic
